topic.title: Running your first N1QL Query
topic.shortdesc: Documents in Couchbase may be queried based on their contents using the N1QL query language. The N1QL query language is inspired by SQL, but also contains special syntax and extensions for dealing with flexible and nested JSON documents. This section will show you how to execute N1QL queries on Couchbase documents using the command line query shell (cbq) as well as the web-based Query Workbench.

body.p: You can refer to for a more thorough overview of the N1QL query language and how to use it with SDKs.
body.section:
PrerequisitesTo use N1QL queries, your cluster must have at least one node with the query and index services enabled. The examples in this documentation will assume you have travel-sample bucket installed. You can query other buckets as well, so long as they have indexes defined
This document assumes some familiarity with SQL. If you have never used SQL, you can follow the N1QL tutorial [TODO: Link].

section.title: Querying via cbq
section.p: The interactive shell cbq for executing N1QL queries is shipped with Couchbase Server and designed to be run on a cluster node:

ol.li: Ensure you are logged into a shell (e.g. bash) on one of the cluster nodes, e.g.ssh unixuser@node-ip-address
Navigate to the Couchbase tools directory, which varies based on the operation systemcd /opt/couchbase/bincd /"Applications/Couchbase Server.app/Contents/Resources/couchbase-core/bin"

section.p: The above example selects all documents that have a type of airport and a city of Reno.
